page.title: 01The Island of Alderney
page.content: Alderney is the third largest of the Channel Islands.It is perhaps the only true Channel Island as it is the most northerly and therefore actually in the English Channel.It is about five kms long and two kms wide and is only ten kms from France - a fact that has had a decisive effect on its history. It is an island of contrasts - the eastern end of the island is flat and has many fine beaches while the western end has some spectacular cliffs.On either side of the island are fierce tidal currents which in particular places can run up to ten knots. In 1981 2056 people lived on the island and its revenue was derived from retirement income,fishing ,farming,finance and tourism.
